author: yperbasis
content: I suggest to omit EIP-6780 from devnet 8. There're a few reasons: 1) devnet 8 introduces quite a few changes already on top of devnet 7 (EIP-1153, 4788, 5656); 2) we (erigon) and perhaps geth haven't implemented it yet; and 3) there're no ethereum/tests for it yet.

author: barnabasbusa
content: the idea of devnet 8 was to create a network that will be as close to final version as possible, even if it takes a few extra days for clients to include new EIPs

author: yperbasis
content: To my mind it's better not to rush things and to have devnet 8 as almost final. It's no biggie to have devnet 9 IMO.

author: yperbasis
content: We can discuss it on the ACD call on Thursday.

author: yperbasis
content: OK, geth's implemented it, and we (erigon) can probably piggyback on that. But my points 1 & 3 still stand.

author: parithosh
content: I'd loosely prefer delaying devnet-8 until tests are mostly passing and people are comfortable launching it. The overhead of changing which EIPs are included is a bit too high and we'd avoid that if we stick to all EIPs + delay until people feel ready-ish.

author: _shemnon
content: for 3) - the execution-spec-tests repos have tests for it - https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/tree/main/tests/cancun - any other client can be used to fill them and make state tests for them.  I know geth and besu both pass those tests and it's uncovered some required Besu changes in the process, so I'd say it has some valuable coverage.
